intro: Phacelia foetida, commonly known as stinking phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its distinctive, strong odor has earned it its common name, and it serves as a food source for various pollinators. Phacelia foetida is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
